alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; St. Louis (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 03 at 9:15PM CDT until August 07 at 1:27PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Meramec River near Eureka. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meramec River near Eureka. * WHEN...From Friday evening to early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, West Spring River Road becomes inundated at this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 20.5 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed Meramec River Eureka 19.0 10.2 20.0 19.1 13.9 9.2 6.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The National Weather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
